### Solución 

```


┌──(kali㉿kali)-[~]
└─$ nc jupiter.challenges.picoctf.org 1981
Good morning class! It's me Ms. Adleman-Shamir-Rivest
Today we will be taking a pop quiz, so I hope you studied. Cramming just will not do!
You will need to tell me if each example is possible, given your extensive crypto knowledge.
Inputs and outputs are in decimal. No hex here!
#### NEW PROBLEM ####
q : 60413
p : 76753
##### PRODUCE THE FOLLOWING ####
n
IS THIS POSSIBLE and FEASIBLE? (Y/N):y
#### TIME TO SHOW ME WHAT YOU GOT! ###
n: 4636878989
Outstanding move!!!
```

``` bash 
#### NEW PROBLEM ####
p : 54269
n : 5051846941
##### PRODUCE THE FOLLOWING ####
q
IS THIS POSSIBLE and FEASIBLE? (Y/N):y
#### TIME TO SHOW ME WHAT YOU GOT! ###
q: 93089
Outstanding move!!!

```

``` python 
Python 3.10.9 (main, Dec  7 2022, 13:47:07) [GCC 12.2.0] on linux
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> p = 54269
>>> n = 5051846941
>>> q = n // p
>>> q
93089
```

``` bash

n : 
##### PRODUCE THE FOLLOWING ####
q
p
IS THIS POSSIBLE and FEASIBLE? (Y/N):n
Outstanding move!!!
```

``` bash 
#### NEW PROBLEM ####
q : 66347
p : 12611
##### PRODUCE THE FOLLOWING ####
totient(n)
IS THIS POSSIBLE and FEASIBLE? (Y/N):y
#### TIME TO SHOW ME WHAT YOU GOT! ###
totient(n): 836623060
Outstanding move!!!

```

``` python 
Python 3.10.9 (main, Dec  7 2022, 13:47:07) [GCC 12.2.0] on linux
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> q = 66347
>>> p = 12611
>>> n = (p-1)*(q-1)
>>> n
836623060
```

Python 3.10.9 (main, Dec  7 2022, 13:47:07) [GCC 12.2.0] on linux
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> m = 6357294171489311547190987615544575133581967886499484091352661406414044440475205342882841236357665973431462491355089413710392273380203038793241564304774271529108729717
>>> n =

>>> pow(m,e,n)

``` bash 
#### NEW PROBLEM ####
q : 
p : 
e : 65537
##### PRODUCE THE FOLLOWING ####
d
IS THIS POSSIBLE and FEASIBLE? (Y/N):y
#### TIME TO SHOW ME WHAT YOU GOT! ###
d: 
Outstanding move!!!

```

``` python 
q = 
p = 
e = 65537
tn = (p-1)*(q-1)
d = inverse(e,tn)
print(d )

```

``` bash 
#### NEW PROBLEM ####
p : 
ciphertext : 
e : 65537
n : 
##### PRODUCE THE FOLLOWING ####
plaintext
IS THIS POSSIBLE and FEASIBLE? (Y/N):y
#### TIME TO SHOW ME WHAT YOU GOT! ###
plaintext: 14311663942709674867122208214901970650496788151239520971623411712977120586163535880168563325
Outstanding move!!!

```

``` python
from Crypto.Util.number import inverse
p = 
c = 
e = 65537
n = 

  

q = n // p

tn = (p-1)*(q-1)

d = inverse(e,tn)

m = pow(c,d,n)

print(m)

```

### Notas adicionales:
al final transformamos la cadena a bytes, ya que es la bandera

picoCTF{wA8_th4t$_ill3aGal .. o26cefcb2}
